bio:treatment.discussion: J. L. Reveal (1977c) separated var. avia from var. kanabensis, and believed it to be more closely related to var. angustissima. S. L. Welsh et al. (1993) considered var. avia to be a northern, high elevation variant at the end of a cline within the species. It occurs in loamy, rocky soils instead of the sandy soils that the other varieties inhabit. Little is known about this variety.
